document_data.caption: A map showing the location of the Misty Vale.
document_data.name: The Misty Vale
document_data.mainbody: The '''Misty Vale''' was a hot, dense jungle on a plateau over the [[River Talar]] east of the [[Dun Hills (Lapaliiya)|Dun Hills]] and north of the [[Bandit Wastes]] in [[the Shaar]].
document_data.Geography: * The [[Cliffs of Talar]]<ref group="note">''Demihuman Deities'' indicates the Cliffs of Talar were one of the Misty Vale's borders, while later maps showed the River Talar passing through Misty Vale.
document_data.Defenses: [[Fenmarel Mestarine]] acted through the Misty Vale's predators to protect its inhabitants from unwelcome intruders.
document_data.History:
The Misty Vale was populated by [[Fair Folk]] refugees of the [[Crown Wars|Second Crown War]] and escaped slaves from [[Ilythiir]].

Changes in climate dried out and killed the forest in the 20 years following the [[Spellplague]] of [[1385 DR]]. Its remains became the [[Dead Vale]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The tribes of Elfharrow believed a mystical tree called [[Cuivanu]] grew in the heart of the Misty Vale.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The [[wild elf]] inhabitants of the Misty Vale called themselves [[Or-Tel'Quessir]] and were known to outsiders as grugach.

The Misty Vale was also home to predatory [[Monstrosity|horrors]] descended from Ilythiiri [[sorcerer]]s' castoff experiments.
